label: Business & Finance
sentence:
Question: give me details in starting a new export business and the requirements to start it?
Answer: You should first find a competitive productive activity (manufacturing or natural resources) in your location and then try to establish a relationship with the providers, this activity may be, for example, artcrafts.  then you have to visit craftman in your location and show interest in buying their products.

International clients are highly demanding, so you must carefully consider build a poll of providers that guarrantee you: quality, quantities and reliability.

Once you have selected the provider then you have the first half (but the most difficult is to come)  now you have to build trust in potential buyers abroad of the product you selected to export.

In my experience I founded very useful the help of my country embassy in other countries, as well as this I highly recommend you to build an online (and printed) catalog. You should be extra careful with details in those marketing materials, NO typos, no false statements, try to be as accurate as possible and, of course, try to have those materials in at least two languages. Also be ready with quotation templates and check the payment method best suits you. again trust is important in this regard.

In this stage you may find in statistics about export of your country (given in any Economy Ministery website) about top foreign countries that most likely buy the kind of products you choose to sell from your location, keep it simple but be persistent as it takes a lot of work to get the first order, however, once you start, yopu will be in one of the most lucratives activities of the world and prosper you, as well as your family.

As you don´t give further details in your question I assume that you are starting from scratch, so, don´t worry, try to strenght relations with your friends and family, and the friends of your friends and the family of your family, try to find in your personal network those fellows that may help you connect the chain (find the best provider or find the first client) in any case prepare your selling speech for each case and be ready to show leadership and motivation, remember that doing business is a human activity and in involves inter-personal relationship skills.

Also, remember to keep it simple, export follows the same principle of local selling, you buy as cheap as possible and sell as expensive as possible (your profit will be the difference)

buy cheap and sell expensive (but be fair in both sides)

Don´t kill the gold eggs chicken by trying to get all the eggs at once, keep you baance and try to not be so greedy.

Beware of international scams!.  In my website www.somosnegocios.com  I have many recommendations for doing business internationally, check in the FAQ section, If you have further questions feel free to ask me.

Best regards

Alejandro

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: How are the concepts of gradualism and punctuated equilibrium different? How are they similar?
Question: I need some Biology help! Can some one explain how allopatric speciation differs from sympatric speciation, and give examples of each? And how are the concepts of gradualism and punctuated equilibrium different, and how are they similar?

Thanks for the help! Biology has proven to be a little out of my realm of comprehension.
Answer: The difference betwen allopatric and sympatric is easy to remember: allopatric is geographical, sympatric is non-geographical.  

Allopatric speciation involves a geographical separation (like a river, a mountain, a drought, separation following a migration, etc.)  Two subpopulations of a species get isolated from each other and evolve separately.  If this isolation is long enough, the two subspecies will first lose the desire, and then the ability to interbreed ... hence speciation.   This is believed to be the most common form of speciation in animals.

Sympatric speciation involves no geographical barrier, the two subspecies share territory.  One way that could happen is if there are two niches (like two types of food) in the same territory .... if some members prefer (or are slightly better adapted) for one food and others prefer the other food, then each will tend to meet and mate more with others of the same preference.  Thus any difference in adaptation between the two subspecies will get amplified, and the two may show less desire, and eventually an inability, to interbreed.  This is considered very rare in the animal kingdom except for insects, but may be more common in plants.  An example commonly given is the apple maggot (a kind of fly).

(See source 1 for a better description.)

Punctuated equilibrium is a theory developed by Niles Elderedge and my favorite science writer, Stephen Jay Gould.  It is the view that species often go through long periods of relative stability (equilibrium) that is broken up (punctuated) by periods of relatively fast change.  (See source 2 for a great illustration of how it works.)

Contrast this with gradualism, which holds that evolutionary change happens at a steady pace. 

They are similar in that they both hold that evolution is a slow process ... in fact, it is a common misconception that they are opposites, when in fact punctuated equilibrium is a form of gradualism because it still holds that evolution is a long gradual process.  (See source 3)

In other words the opposite of gradualism is not punctuated equilibrium, it is something called 'catastrophism', where change occurs as a result of short-lived violent events (catastrophes).  Few scientists today are catastrophists. 

Feel free to email me if any of this is unclear.

label: Health
sentence:
Question: Do these "diets" really work? Like Slimquick and any others you can think of.?
Answer: Any diet will work, keep in mind the following before choosing your next diet:

Diets and changing your eating to healthy food choices can work but because we know so little about ourselves and our relationship with food, it makes it difficult to win the battle. A lot of us have problems with dieting because we have a problem called "emotional eating" we eat to comfort ourselves during difficult, stressful, sad, etc times in our lives.

You may experience all those emotions during dieting as we continuously get on the scale hoping to see a big difference in numbers after dieting only for a day or two. Also what is stressful when dieting is that we try to lose a large number of weight in such a short period of time which in most cases is unreasonable. 

This all brings about stress, discomfort and sadness. When we feel this way, we turn to our best friend for help and support which for many of us is food. The diet is now broken and we feel that we can't stick to diets. We then try fad diet after fad diet hoping to lose the original 20 pounds and now we may have as much as 30 pounds to lose because we continue to put on weight as we continue to break these fad diets by binging before starting our next diet. 

Please learn about your relationship with food before your next diet so that you may achieve your goals. To help a little, keep in mind the following:

You already know how to lose weight. You know that if you eat less and exercise more eventually you’ll see the pounds come off. What’s getting in your way? Why do you usually regain the weight you lost? The answer to all these questions is the same “Emotional Eating.” Simply defined, emotional eating means you eat to satisfy emotional hunger; it means you use food for comfort or as a way to cope with life; and it means you eat for reasons other than what your body needs. Whenever you reach for a boredom-breaking snack despite your commitment, or whenever you eat to quell anxiety, that’s emotional eating. Whenever you binge after a fight, or double up on portions because your day turned sour, that’s emotional eating. Whenever you feel that sharp craving for your favorite food, that’s emotional eating. When we eat during these times while on a diet, we believe the diet doesn’t work or that we lack self control and then look for the quickest way to lose weight (fasting/diet pills, ect) after eating all we can since we already messed the diet day up. Read the information below but remember that emotional eating plays a big part in why we don’t continue dieting and why we regain lost weight and why we binge today and start a new diet tomorrow. Best of Luck.

P.S. After learning about my relationship with food, I was able to drop my weight from 263 pounds down to 151 pounds which is a 112 pound weight lost.

Title: How do I get rid of the dropdown list from the run command?  Start, Run there is a list of recent commands.?
Question: Let me explain: Click on Start, & then Run.  How do I get rid of or clear the list of recent commands I entered (ie. msconfig, regedit)?  

In XP Pro there is something called Group Policy.  It allows you to prevent access to specific programs, removes access to certain things from the Start menu (Control Panel, Windows Explorer, etc.), prevents changing Internet settings, etc.

Many people will have access to this computer, so I'm trying to prevent/remove access to many functions on the computer to prevent people from not using the computer as intended.  But I also want to be able to log in as an Admin & have a normal computer.

When people click on Start there will not be much there, because I have either prevented access or hidden the Icons.  Most people aren't going to know how to undo these changes, unless they know about Group Policy.  The only normal way a person might figure it out would be to click on Run & choose Group Policy from the dropdown list & undo my changes.
Answer: I don't know if this includes the "Run" command, but you can give it a try:

Right-click Start, and choose Properties.  Make sure the "Classic Start menu" radio button is selected, then click Customize.  Click the "Clear" button, and I think that should clear your list.

label: Education & Reference
sentence:
Title: Controling my nervousness while presenting a speech?
Question: On this Wednesday, I have to present a speech in front of the whole class. Problem is, I get really nervous when standing in front of a class to present. My English teacher gave us some helpful hints as to not getting shy and nervous in front of the class, but can anyone else explain a bit more thoroughly? Thanks in advance.
Answer: I am a teacher who also gets very nervous when doing a presentation or workshop in front of my peers, so try these tricks:

1) Practice, practice, practice.  Rehearse in front of your family, friends, a mirror, whatever.  The more you know the material, the easier it will come.  Alot of the times you may get nervous because you are afraid you are going to screw up or look silly.  If you have what you are going to say down, that should help.  

2) Before you go up, use the restroom.  On the way there, take big strides and swing your arms steadily.  Your goal here is to burn off the extra adrenaline and rthe exercise will help you relax.

3) I cannot remember the proper name for this technique, but it DOES work.  Breathe in, tighten your stomach muscles, working from the top ones down to the bottom ones.  What you are doing is burning off excess adrenaline and at the same time breathing slower and deeper.  I use this one every time and it works great.  Once you have finished with the bottom muscles, exhale and repeat.

4)  Relax...Breathe in slowly, hold your breath for 4 to 5 seconds, then slowly exhale.

5)  Remember... that nobody sitting there is judging you.  They all understand how nerve racking it can be to speak in public.  They want you to succeed.

6)  Pick one friendly, smiling face in the crowd and focus on that one person.  This doesn't mean that you don't scan the room and present to the class, but always return your focus to that one person and you will be ok.

Hope this helps!

"There are two types of speakers: those that are nervous and those that are liars". - Mark Twain

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: How are scientists considering creating a quantum computer?
Question: What are the techniques suggested in the process?
Answer: It will utilise quantum mechanics. At the subatomic level, matter behaves very differently to classical mechanics that we are familiar with in everyday life. The spin property of particles is not actually the particle spinning like a top, but is a term given to their angular momentum to help explain their interaction with each other.

Particles can only spin in certain allowable directions, electrons have only 2 directions, other particles can have more. The ability to be in 2 spin states at once is due to uncertainty in that the particle could be in either state until it is observed and probability functions are used to describe its state.

Similarly a particle in a quantum well (a box with walls of electric potential) will move about with its energy in a fashion that can be described by its wave function. At any measurement it will be in a certain point (although with unknown momentum) but it will vary with every measurement.

These sorts of uncertainties are what are scientists are hoping to use in quantum mechanics. Calculations will actually be performed millions of times simultaneously providing varying results, but favourable probabilities will lead to the correct answer with immeasurably small innaccurary.

Potential methods will utilise the spin magnetic moments of electrons, or the position of valence (outer) or free electrons moving between pairs of ions (charged atoms) accurately positioned in a semiconductor. There is still a lot of work required.

label: Business & Finance
sentence:
Title: What's the best way to include reference from my boss I now work with?
Question: I work for a temp agency and my assignment is ending (one year assignment).  I want to include a reference from my supervisors at my work to my resume/application.  Would I just have them as a reference, or could I have them write a letter of recomendation?  Should I go with two or stick with only one?  how long should the recomendation be?  Personal experience only please.
Answer: Ask for a written letter of recommendation.  People move on, you might not be able to track him down in the future.  Present him with a written reminder list of things you have done while on that one year assignment.  

I have 3 letters of recommendation which have helped me tremendously. 2 of the 3 bosses are no longer with the company I worked for.  I include them when I apply for some jobs because I have moved to another state.  So instead of asking future employers to make a long distance phone call, they have that letter right there.  They probably still want to call if I am a serious candidiate for the job, but in the meantime they have proof of satisfying some other former employers.  

When you work for a temp agency, so many times you are just "that temp guy".  If you have established a rapport with someone at an assignment, I think it's vital for you to get a letter.  The HR department at that company can't verify what you did, they can only see that for XX amount of time, they had someone outsourced from XX company.  You didn't technically work for that firm, you are employed techincally by the temp agency.  That is why it's even more important for somone in your situation to ask for letters if people are willing to write them.

Good luck on your next gig!

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: Gas Laws - uses and applications?
Question: I have to write a general essay on the uses and applications of the Gas Laws (Boyles's, Charles', Gay-Lussac's, Avogadro's), Fick's Law of Diffusion, Dalton's Law of Partial Pressures and Henry's Law of Solubility to the Biosciences.b (1000 words)

I am not required to re-define or to cite any of the laws in equation/formula or mathematecal format.

Just wondered if anyone could provide me with some good book or website names which would be useful for this.

I need something relatively simple - this is the first time I've come across these laws and the lecture on them is only 3 days before the assignment deadline - I need to make a start and would appreciate any info - THANKYOU!
Answer: Geez, that's a beast of an assignment if you haven't even heard of these laws before.

None of these laws are recent, so any good encyclopedia should have lots of information about them.  Even Wikipedia, but always take wikipedia with a grain of salt, since it's nonprofessional and many professors don't accept citations from it.

The gas laws should be pretty well covered in an elementary chemistry textbook.  I really can't recall if such a book would cover Fickian diffusion, but Dalton's law and Henry's law should be in there as well.  If you have a chapter in your course textbook about blood chemistry, that might be a place to look, as Dalton's law deals with the partial pressure of gases, and Henry's law with the solubility of gases in liquids.  Fick's law would certainly be covered in any references about the lungs.

label: Family & Relationships
sentence:
Title: Does anyone know how to be really romantic without annoying surrounding people??? PLEASE HELP ME!!!!:-S?
Question: Me and my boyfrind have been having problems- he says im not romantic but i dont know how to be romantic without offending my friends. what can i do? i really love him , dont wanna lose him but i have not got a clue what to do!!!!!
Answer: One of the easiest ways is to start slow and gradually introduce intimacy back into the relationship.
For instance, you may introduce a rule to yourself:
"make sure I hug my partner at least three times a day"
just simple acts like this, which are quick to perform, can have a profound effect with regard adding romance into a relationship.
Or ,get up early one day and go and watch the sunrise together.
This is the sort of thing that many women love, and whilst you may find it a little boring is a classic way of adding romance to your relationship.
On a warm night before what will be another warm day, there is something incredibly romantic about sharing watching a sunrise together, as the night and darkness gives way to the light of day.
The cool air, the change in light levels and the relative quiet of that early morning gives you an almost humbling sensation or an awe of the true beauty and power of nature, and sharing this together is what makes it so romantic.
Advice: Don’t involve your friends in your relationships.

label: Politics & Government
sentence:
Title: What is Spangdahlem Germany like?
Question: How is it to be statinoed there in the USAF?
Answer: As you know, I've also answered your question about Ramstein; so I'll give you more details for both here -- rather than writing out the same answer twice.

Bottom Line TRUTH: "What you get out of an overseas assignment is a direct measure of what you put into it -- period!"

There are a lot of people who sit around base all day long, and never do anything or go anywhere. If you ask them how they liked their assignment they'll tell you it was terrible because "There's nothing to do." But if you put in nothing, you get nothing -- it's that simple. Now, if you're willing to get out -- there's tons of things to do.

Spangdahlem is almost right on the border with Belgium. There are all sorts of places you can go for a day trip. You can go to Brussels, Amsterdam, Paris. All of these are a few hours away.
The city of Trier, nearby Spang, is the oldest city in Germany, and has old Roman ruins, and great shopping. 

Every base offers language courses to help you integrate. If you're willing to extend the effort, you can learn the language, and do even more. Also, Both Ramstein and Spang offer university courses with the University of Maryland where you can get your education through a Master's Degree.

You can go skiing in the Alps, and visit King Ludwig's castles (AWESOME). You can take tours offered by the base and visit anyplace in europe you want to go: Italy? England? Spain? You name it, there are tours.

Also, there's a company called "Ryanair" that flies out of a nearby commercial airport that offers super-cheap airfares (say -- twenty dollars -- round trip) to London, and to many other locales in Europe. Take advantage of it.

Both Ramstein and Spang have very active Officers' and Enlisted Spouce's organizations. If you want to be involved with base activities and meet new friends, you'll have all the opportunities you want.

You can travel, you can sightsee, you can shop, you can take classes, you can be involved with the community. You can be as involved and active as you wish. That's what I mean when I say, that what you get out of the experience is exactly what you put into it.

Any questions??

label: Computers & Internet
sentence:
Title: Can u send a fax from your computer if u have Cable?
Question: I don't have a fax machine, i am using the built in Microsoft Fax console, but can never send a fax. My comuter has a built in fax modem. My computer makes a tone, but of course I don't have a phone line hooked up because I am using cable to access internet. So, Do I also need to pug in a phone line then? If so can I just hook line straight from wall jack to computer? Also, when I type in the number to be dialed do I put in dashes or spaces?
Answer: For starters, make sure you're plugging your cable from your wall to the correct jack in your modem.  One usually has a phone icon - don't use that one for the wall connection.  Use that for an actual phone.

If your hear a dial tone from your speakers when you try to fax someone, then that's a good thing - your fax is trying to start up and dial.  If you don't hear a dial tone, again check your plugs.  It may even help to check the wall outlet as well, since that may be part of the problem.

As for dialing, you can usually go either way with dashes or no dashes.  Just be sure to use area codes where necessary.

Now be warned - sometimes sending a fax over a cable modem won't work out.  I've had that told to me once, and it turned out that it did work in my case.  But then recently, I tried to fax and they didn't go through all the way.  I had to do some fancy trickery to get things right again, but it worked out in the end.

BTW, the link below is from Microsoft's website.  It may help with some minor usage and troubleshooting.

Question: what is an opto-coupler?
Answer: In electronics, an opto-isolator (or optical isolator, optocoupler) is a device that uses a short optical transmission path to transfer a signal between elements of a circuit, typically a transmitter and a receiver, while keeping them electrically isolated — since the signal goes from an electrical signal to an optical signal back to an electrical signal, electrical contact along the path is broken.\nA common implementation involves an LED and a light sensor, separated so that light may travel across a barrier but electrical current may not.

label: Science & Mathematics
sentence:
Title: If a right triangle had an adjacent of 8 and an opposite 6...What would the hypotenuse n all of the angles be?
Question: How did you get that answer? explain. need some help with my trig!
Answer: The easy way to remember this is to memorize the 

3 4 5 

right triangle.  You will notice that any two multiples of the above will give you the other leg as a multiple.  The theorem is

A^2 + B^2 = C^2,  so  3^2 + 4^2 = 5^2,  hence  9 + 16 = 25

now you have

2*3 2*4 thus your other leg is 2*5

6^2 + 8^2 = 10^2,  which is 36 + 64 = 100

as for the angles, use the law of sines

sin(90)/5 = sin(a)/3 = sin(b)/4

so a = asin(sin(90)*3/5) = ~37 deg

hence angles of 90 53 37

Title: y did god made barfing exist?
Question: because it hurts realy bad!
Answer: Vomiting, aka barfing, is one of our oldest mechanisms of defense... you can say from when Man was like an animal, picking stuff up from off the ground and putting it in his mouth to find out if it could be eaten... dogs and other animals use it, too.

It's proved so effective, we still use it to the day and it keeps us from getting intoxicated by substances like rotten food, certain drugs, alcohol, etc.  Of course, like any defense mechanism, it can sometimes be an exaggerated response of our body and then it's very annoying, to say the least.

By the way, when people vomit after chemotherapy, surgery (general anesthesia) or brain disease (meningitis) the problem is an abnormal stimulation to their brainstem that makes their body want to expulse it's stomach contant quickly and forcefully.

Title: How many units do you have to have to minor in something?
Question: And how many units to major in something? And how many units equals an Associates Degree? And Bachelors? And Masters? And Ph.D?
Answer: Depends on the University and the program, they are all different and measure units differently.  Northwestern measures units as individual classes so one class equals one credit, while other schools measure a credit hour based on how many hours of class you have each week in that class and so on.  For associates typically, 60 hours, Bachelors 120 hours.  A masters depends on the program and where you go.  A lot of masters degrees are 24-30 hours beyond a Bachelors but you can't take the same amount of classes at a time.  A Ph.D. can take from 3-7 years depending on the degree and program beyond your masters.  It all depends in what and where you go.

label: Health

Question: What are some Psychological issues that would cause people to want to where diapers just for fun?
Answer: More than likely "regression," where people want to go back to a time when they felt safe and/or loved and didn't have the pressures and stresses of adult life.  It's a coping mechanism and an attempted escape from reality.
